page.title: 12DUNSFORD VILLAGE HALL.
page.content: Most villages have a hall and these, together with churches local inns and schools give a base for the many local societies. Dunsford hall was built in 1930.A stage and other extensions have been added.It can seat over 100.It is run by a committee made up of members representing each of the local organisations that may use it.This committee runs activities to finance hall costs not covered by hiring fees. Some examples of use are, pantomines, plays,reviews,horticulture shows,whist drives,bingo,dances,disco,square dances,keep fit classes,society meetings,school use for drama and P.E. table tennis,junior sports activities, wedding receptions,birthday parties etc.
